title: One of the better changes coming out of 9.3
body:
https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/343055498351738882/542729188730339356/unknown.png

Now we can tell just how hard we have to try in lane, or how safely we have to play if our match-up is a bit shaky in favor of our champ without feeding 1 kill because you underestimated how good the enemy laner was at their champion.

replies.body: That is the biggest fuckery for OTPs, so fuck me.
Why?

If it shows MP of the enemy laner and its like 700MP+ then he can get camped heavily by the jungler or/and mid laner too. It's pretty easy to guess Riot did that change not only for info gathering but also to discourage OTP'ing.

\* Looks at username \*

Yeah... I don't think they needed to see your champion mastery to guess you were a OTP.
LMAO xD
Not everyone has their name of their champion.

Ufff I have 850k{{champion:33}}  xD
It should transmit fear to enemy laners.

It doesnt change anything. Just shows you play one champ a lot. 

If I'm on a game against a 2 mil gold malzahar and a 50K diamond urgot.

The urgot is gunna be better.

Mastery points dont mean anything but either spamming a champion or botting games to spam as much as possible for max mastery points.
Most don't use MP that way.

I mean. I have the most mastery points on Galio in NA. 

Theres no point camping me cause I'm meh and camping me doesnt really do much lol
No I have the most galio mastery points na....

Nuh uh. I do. :p

The guy with the most in the world I'm consonance is a bot doe.

It depends on the champion too, Akali without her W is so easy to gank or/and tower dive if your near full health (Because she can burst you with her ULT, like any assassin).

If you tower dive a tank you'll probably lose since hes tanky, CC, maybe has a heal or a shield and might do unexpected dmg + tower damage.

I honestly dont think anyone realistically cares what someones mastery points are when determining what they will do in a game.

Junglers ruining their pathing to 'try'and pick on someone wont work most of the time. 

Also a players skill has nothing to do with mastery points.

If anything being able to see mastery points in the loading screen is for one tricks who want to show off how big their points are.
Yes MP doesn't always mean the player is skilled, but it's a decent indication that this player might be decent at the champ.

I always thought that mastery at the very least should be public once the loading screen happens, at least I know what to expect from my opponents and who to be more careful about.
